title: 335-B
statement: B. Palindrometime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutGiven a strings, determine if it contains any palindrome of length exactly100as asubsequence. If it has any, print any one of them. If it doesn't have any, print a palindrome that is a subsequence ofsand is as long as possible.InputThe only line of the input contains one stringsof lengthn(1 ≤n≤ 5·104) containing only lowercase English letters.OutputIfscontains a palindrome of length exactly100as a subsequence, print any palindrome of length100which is a subsequence ofs. Ifsdoesn't contain any palindromes of length exactly100, print a palindrome that is a subsequence ofsand is as long as possible.If there exists multiple answers, you are allowed to print any of them.ExamplesInputbbbabcbbbOutputbbbcbbbInputrquwmzexectvnbanemsmdufrgOutputrumenanemurNoteA subsequence of a string is a string that can be derived from it by deleting some characters without changing the order of the remaining characters. A palindrome is a string that reads the same forward or backward.

processed.result:
Given a string of lowercase English letters, determine if it contains a palindrome of length 100 as a subsequence. 

* If it does, print any one of them.
* If it doesn't, print the longest possible palindrome that is a subsequence of the given string.

**Remember:**

* A subsequence is a sequence of characters from the original string where the order is preserved, but some characters may be missing.
* A palindrome is a sequence that reads the same backward as forward.
Given a string, find the longest possible palindrome that is also a subsequence of the string. If a palindrome of length 100 exists within the string, print that.
